TopicTitle: Can't jetpack rescued Kerbal on EVA?

Articles.Content:
Hi everyone,

Just coming back to KSP after a year-long hiatus, and for the first time I'm confused beyond help. I just updated to 1.1.3 (from 1.0.2) and now I seem to be unable to control rescued Kerbals on EVA from their original ship onto the rescue ship waiting nearby. I can move them up and down the (short) ladder on the original capsule just fine, but they don't seem to have a jetpack that I can control, despite having 5.00 Eva Propellant listed on the fuel display. Their light toggles just fine, also.

This is, as they say, problematic, especially since due to fuel constraints I can't get much closer than ~200m with my rescue ship. Definitely not enough to position my ship directly beneath the EVA so I can just walk off the ladder... I've been looking around and can't find anything about this on the wiki or on the forums. Has anyone else had this problem?

Thanks!

- ethereal

Ohhh I feel stupid. Forgot to toggle RCS. Sorry for the stupid question.

- ethereal
